content.title: Common Femoral Artery Anatomy
content.description: Critical vessel serving as the main arterial access site and key surgical landmark in lower extremity vascular surgery.
content.origin: Continuation of external iliac artery below inguinal ligament
content.termination: Bifurcates into superficial and deep (profunda) femoral arteries

femoral_triangle.contents_lateral_to_medial: NAVEL (Nerve, Artery, Vein, Empty space, Lymphatics)

surgical_significance.bypass: Common origin or target for bypass grafts

content.statement: Common Femoral Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Lower-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Common Femoral Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Common Femoral Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Common Femoral Artery Anatomy.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Common Femoral Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
